Package com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.xpf Description

A collection of classes for reading and writing puzzles in the Universal Crossword Puzzle Format (XPF).

XPF is a file format developed by Jim Horne. The format is based upon XML and was designed to provide maximum flexibility in representing crossword puzzles. The XPF Specification is available on XWordInfo.

A single XPF puzzle is represented by a XPFPuzzle object. Because an XPF file may contain multiple puzzles, the serializer and deserializer classes work with the XPFPuzzleCollection class.

  • The XPFPuzzleOutputStream is used to convert a byte[] representation of an XPF file into a XPFPuzzleCollection object.
  • The XPFPuzzleInputStream is used to convert a XPFPuzzleCollection object into a byte[] representation of an XPF file.
